= HW1 =
For deadline and submission instructions see [https://code.google.com/p/nyu-gaming-course-2013/wiki/Grading Grading].

Administration stuff to do:
  * Choose your group.
  * Add your name & NYU & Google id with links to your individual and group projects to our  [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AvLEQb_5Yz6RdHRmb3RReDFnSWJRWm1EakJaTGozSnc#gid=2 spreadsheet]
  * Register to [https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!forum/nyu-gaming-course-fall-2013 our Google group]. If you have any problems or questions, send an email to our group: nyu-gaming-course-fall-2013@googlegroups.com

  * Install [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7u9-downloads-1859576.html Java JDK SE 7 Java]
  * Install and configure [Eclipse]

==Individual HW1==
Choose your individual game: it must be a turn-based two-player game.
You can choose from this list:
  # Backgammon
  # shogi
  # go
  # xiangqi (chinese chess)
  # reversi (Othello)
  # connect4 (four in a line)
  # checkers
  # chinese_checkers
  # nine_mens_morris
  # Stratego

Write *20-30* unit tests for your game logic.
For example, [https://code.google.com/p/nyu-gaming-course-2013/source/browse/trunk/eclipse/test/org/jiangfengchen/hw1/AbstractStateChangerCaptureForBlack.java tests for legal chess capturing moves] and [https://code.google.com/p/nyu-gaming-course-2013/source/browse/trunk/eclipse/test/org/jiangfengchen/hw1/AbstractStateChangerIllegalBlackCapture.java tests for illegal moves].

All your tests should fail now, because your implementation is just a stub.
After HW2, all the tests should pass (unless you have bugs in your tests or implementation).

==Group HW1==
Choose your group gaming project - this project is completely open ended and up to you.
Here are some ideas you could choose:
  # [https://developers.google.com/glass/ Google Glass API]
  # [https://developers.google.com/games/services/ Google Game Service]: you can do real-time multiplayer games for Android.
  # Khan Academy: Look at their [https://github.com/Khan/khan-exercises exercises framework] and at their [https://github.com/Khan/khan-api/wiki/Khan-Academy-API Khan Academy API]
  # A mobile game that uses some novel feature, such as GPS, Google maps, Camera, Accelerometer, Compass, Microphone.
  # Google Play For Education
  # Video & audio chat
  # Physics based game, style angry birds
